data.title: What is the bare minimum for Javascript syntax checking?
Turn off adding a space after selecting intellisense option with tab.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: 14971

Can't search for anything VScode on Bing as you get all for Visual Studio...

Is there a way to turn off the auto addition of a space after tabbing to select an intellisense choice? So when I'm typing in CSS and I tab to select something, it automatically adds a space after the colon which I don't want and can't find where to change anywhere in any of the settings.

Am I overlooking this or can I request this option?

data.title: cursorMove command needs to know which end of selection is moving.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0 insiders
- OS Version: macOS Sierra

For VSCodeVim, we need to be able to tell the cursorMove command if the start or the end of the active selection is moving. 

Quasi-Related: #16248

data.title: Preview mode breaks clicking on link to a section in file, preview turn dark.

data.title: Error in syntax highlighting in JS computed property name expression
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Paste following code in editor:
```js
  const a = {
    [[foo, bar].join(',')]: 3
  }
```
2. Set language mode to JavaScript
3. Observe the error:

data.title: Save All Keyboard shortcut
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0 Insider
- OS Version: Insider Build 14971
I would like to see a "Save All" shortcut button combo. I am usually editing and writing different files in the same project and I wish to edit like for example 5-6 files and then have a shortcut key combo that will Save All of the files at once. I don't know if this will be easy to implement since Ctrl-Shift-S is already "Save As". Its not a high priority, its just something that I would want as an easy way o save the whole project with my keyboard.

data.title: Is it possible to get the detected tabSize value?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0 Insiders
- OS Version: MacOS Sierra

I'm developing an extension and I would like to get the tabSize value of a file.

I tried this in a file that has a tab size of 4:

`vscode.workspace.getConfiguration("editor").get("tabSize");`

However, that returns `2` in a file that clearly has a tab size of `4`. I think this is because in my settings.json I set `tabSize` to `2`. 

Is it possible to get the effective value?

data.title: Panel Terminal, Panel Console and easy switching between them
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.8.0-Insider - OS Version: OS X Yosemite Feature request: It would be nice to have a widget that allows me to easily switch between OUTPUT, TERMINAL, DEBUG CONSOLE, and PROBLEMS. While I'm at it, I wish that the upside down caret that minimizes the various terminals was a different thing, because I always want that thing to be my widget to choose among the 4 items I list above, because it seems that it would activate a menu or other visual cue to change between things. It should be a little 'x'.

data.title: Open Preview shows wrong file in preview tab (markdown)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a Folder with several .md files
2. Open a few of the .md files
3. click Open Preview to view the rendered markdown

The preview shown often does not match the file that was active when the Open preview command was invoked.

I've never changed settings explicitly. But here are the files:

user settings.json:
```json
{
    "git.confirmSync": false
}
```
workspace settings.json:
```json
// Place your settings in this file to overwrite default and user settings.
{
}
```
![previewtab](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3548/20874531/ac1ee6b2-ba67-11e6-8f24-261bb138e6a3.gif)

data.title: Allow to switch between recently used editors regardless of which group they are in
data.body:
Please implement commands to switch between recently used editors regardless of which group the editors are in. Currently, it seems as though there is only a command to switch between recently used editors in a group.

The [workaround suggested by bpasero](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/16238#issuecomment-263790540) in issue #16238 is far less than ideal. It takes too many keystrokes to switch between the active document in each group.

Currently, I see the following two commands:

- `workbench.action.openNextRecentlyUsedEditorInGroup`
- `workbench.action.openNextRecentlyUsedEditorInGroup`

However, I would like to see two additional commands:

- `workbench.action.openNextRecentlyUsedEditor`
- `workbench.action.openPreviousRecentlyUsedEditor`

Thank you.

data.title: CMD + Backspace while at Col 1 should remove line
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.1

CMD + Backspace at the end of a line properly removes the characters line, leaving the cursor at Col 1. But using the same combo a second time does nothing. You have to release CMD for Backspace to remove the line. You should be able to keep CMD pressed and either remove all the characters in a line, or remove the line itself if the line is empty.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Starting at the right of a line of characters, use CMD + Backspace to remove the characters.
2. Hit the same combo again, and the line isn't removed.

data.title: dropdown decorator only works for first setting with multiple settings on a single line
data.body:
if i have two or more settings on a single line, the decorator shows up for the first thing on the line...

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1487073/20865900/59b4ffa4-ba1e-11e6-8c8b-b4b7f7647559.png)

i expected to be able to hover around the "false" value in the middle of the line and see a decorator there that would give me the dropdown.

data.title: action decoration in settings file makes it hard to put cursor at end of line
data.body:
i opened my settings.json and wanted to add a new setting at the end of the file.  I moved my mouse to the end of the line and clicked to set the cursor, but instead i clicked on the decorator and i got a drop down.

So to put the cursor at the end of the line with the mouse i have to either click after the decorator or click in the single space between the end of the line and the decorator. 

If all lines had a decorator at the end i could get used to having to click way to the right. but not all settings have drop downs.

i dont have a good solution :).  Maybe the decorator needs to show up right next to the value so there isn't the temptation to try to click between the end of the word and the decorator.

data.title: Drop event of file dragged from File Explorer lost when on secondary monitor

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 Insider Preview build 14971

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Find a Windows 10 PC with dual monitors. I suspect that the two monitors must have different DPI/scaling settings.
2. Run VS Code on one monitor.
3. Drag a file from Windows' File Explorer into the explorer pane in Code.
4. Either:
    - The file is successfully copied to the open folder in Code and the application resets to normal. If so, move VS Code to the other monitor and restart at step 1.
    - The file is not copied, and the explorer pane maintains the light background that indicated that it was a drop surface. Clicking out of the pane or selecting other items does not resolve this state, and one must reload the workspace.

I have a primary 4K monitor at 150% DIP scaling and a 1080p monitor at 100%. I see this issue when Code is on my secondary monitor, but not when it's on my primary. It looks like some variety of coordinate translation isn't working correctly and as a result the drop event doesn't register; this leaves it in a "limbo" state waiting to receive an event.

It's worth noting that, when this bug is encountered, everything _looks_ normal until the drop doesn't register. The app successfully detects the drag beginning and highlights the drop area as expected. This is how it looks afterward:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3310349/20864745/37df5bb8-b9b0-11e6-9ccb-f8a2f05bf9e8.png)

There are no useful log items in the dev console. Unfortunately, I can't get a GIF of this because the apps I normally use for that have issues with DPI transitions too :laughing:

The most valuable feature to me is that vscode can auto format a file, but every time i upgrades it loses this ability!

Why should an editor getting more and more useless to a user when it gets updated?

data.title: Improve search performance.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Search for text in a large folder
2. Open a cmd window and search for the same text using "findstr".
3. Note how findstr is an order of magnitude faster.

Searching for stuff is a key operation. It shouldn't be this slow.

data.title: New settings left pane should scale with editor.fontSize
data.body: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/20863589/87ee74e4-b984-11e6-9602-a89de2b12780.png)

data.title: Terminal font size should not scale with the editor's
data.body: None of the panels scale with the editor font size so the terminal shouldn't either. The terminal also doesn't seem to support resizing properly when the editor's font size is inherited.

data.title: Expand PickList to support Images or other Icon Fonts
data.body:
Today, you are able to embed icons in the text of the PickList items using **Octicons**, via `$(icon-name)`.

It would be a great addition to support Images, like in `ThemableDecorationRenderOptions.gutterIconPath`, or other Icon Fonts like **FontAwesome**, **FontMfizz**, etc.

Thanks in advance.
